Package com.illposed.osc

Class OSCPortIn

java.lang.Object
com.illposed.osc.OSCPort
com.illposed.osc.OSCPortIn
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class OSCPortIn
extends OSCPort
implements java.lang.Runnable
OSCPortIn is the class that listens for OSC messages. An example:
(loosely based on {com.illposed.osc.OSCPortTest#testReceiving()}) 

 receiver = new OSCPortIn(OSCPort.DEFAULT_SC_OSC_PORT());
 OSCListener listener = new OSCListener() {
 	public void acceptMessage(java.util.Date time, OSCMessage message) {
 		System.out.println("Message received!");
 	}
 };
 receiver.addListener("/message/receiving", listener);
 receiver.startListening();
Then, using a program such as SuperCollider or sendOSC, send a message to this computer, port OSCPort.DEFAULT_SC_OSC_PORT, with the address "/message/receiving".

  • Constructor Details

    • OSCPortIn

      public OSCPortIn​(java.net.DatagramSocket socket)
      Create an OSCPort that listens using a specified socket.
      Parameters:
      socket - DatagramSocket to listen on.

    • OSCPortIn

      public OSCPortIn​(int port) throws java.net.SocketException
      Create an OSCPort that listens on the specified port. Strings will be decoded using the systems default character set.
      Parameters:
      port - UDP port to listen on.
      Throws:
      java.net.SocketException - if the port number is invalid, or there is already a socket listening on it

    • OSCPortIn

      public OSCPortIn​(int port, java.nio.charset.Charset charset) throws java.net.SocketException
      Create an OSCPort that listens on the specified port, and decodes strings with a specific character set.
      Parameters:
      port - UDP port to listen on.
      charset - how to decode strings read from incoming packages. This includes message addresses and string parameters.
      Throws:
      java.net.SocketException - if the port number is invalid, or there is already a socket listening on it

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Run the loop that listens for OSC on a socket until isListening() becomes false.
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
      See Also:
      Runnable.run()

      public void startListening()
      Start listening for incoming OSCPackets

      public void stopListening()
      Stop listening for incoming OSCPackets

    • isListening

      public boolean isListening()
      Am I listening for packets?
      Returns:
      true if this port is in listening mode

    • addListener

      public void addListener​(java.lang.String addressSelector, OSCListener listener)
      Registers a listener that will be notified of incoming messages, if their address matches the given pattern.
      Parameters:
      addressSelector - either a fixed address like "/sc/mixer/volume", or a selector pattern (a mix between wildcards and regex) like "/??/mixer/*", see OSCPatternAddressSelector for details
      listener - will be notified of incoming packets, if they match

    • addListener

      public void addListener​(AddressSelector addressSelector, OSCListener listener)
      Registers a listener that will be notified of incoming messages, if their address matches the given selector.
      Parameters:
      addressSelector - a custom address selector
      listener - will be notified of incoming packets, if they match
